attributes.action: Bar Johnson, Gove and Farage from public office for lying in Brexit debate.
attributes.additional_details:
Throughout the campaign Boris Johnson, Michael Gove and Nigel Farage repeatedly made a number of dishonest claims. 
One very clear example was that the UK paid £350m a week to the EU and this would be freed to use on the NHS if we left.  
Net of an immediate rebate (which never leaves the UK) the figure was £247m per week and net of payments to UK entities (which they said would continue to be paid) the figure was £136m per week.
attributes.background:
In the Brexit debate there was dishonesty which one leading law professor described "on an industrial scale". 
People made the most important decision of a generation on the basis of misinformation which was cynically presented as fact. Messrs Johnson, Gove and Farage were at the core.
